About Kendo  The concept of kendo is to discipline the human character through the principles of the katana.
 ~ The All Japan Kendo Federation
Kendo (剣道), “The Way of The Sword”, is a traditional Japanese martial art, descending from kenjutsu (Japanese swordsmanship).
In Kendo, practitioners wear bogu (armour) and use shinai (bamboo swords) to strike one another while performing specialised footwork and kiai (shout). Practitioners test their skills against each other in matches called shiai. The contest of skills with an opponent gives kendo an athletic aspect which draws many to the art. However, the main focus of kendo is on the the philosophical aspects of discipline and the cultivation of the mind, body and spirit through continued keiko (practice).
About MUKC We are Monash University Kendo Club, also known as MUKC. We are a Monash University Sports club, and are predominantly student-run with guidance from qualified instructors. As the name suggests, our club practices kendo, as a means of training both our minds and bodies.
We conduct one beginner’s course a year, which starts in February/March when the first university semester begins. The club holds three trainings per week. Social functions and competitions are also held throughout the year. Anyone who is interested in kendo is more than welcome to come and watch our training sessions or to contact us for more information.
Among our members and instructors, are people who have international experience, and are state and national representatives. Our members come from all walks of life, are of various ages and are very welcoming. Feel free to speak to any of us before or after training when we’re hanging out outside the Games Hall where we train.

title: Beginners

content:
Just beginning your Kendo journey? Want to learn more? Come and watch us during our regular training - anyone is welcome! In fact, we regularly have an audience of the general public.
Please be aware that if you want to chat with any of the members or the Club committee, please wait until training has finished. We cannot chat with you once training has started.

We hold a beginners course once a year in February/March! The first few sessions are free, so come along and see what it’s all about! Please see the link below for more information.
 Want to train with us? For people with no prior Kendo experience, and for experienced Kendoka, please visit MonashSport –> Kendo –> Join Us.
Members training Tip
Please double check our Facebook group for any last-minute changes to the below training times. This is especially the case if the date is near
 Conflicting VKR and AKR Kendo events, e.g. yearly Nittaidai visit Public holidays University holidays Public emergencies, e.g. COVID lockdowns  You can find us training in Monash Sport, 42 Scenic Boulevard, Monash University Clayton Campus at the following times:
 Monday 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm (Games Hall) Wednesday 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm (Games Hall) Saturday 9:00 am - 10:30 am (Stadium) - senior members (training in full armour) only     
How to get there The Monash Univeristy website has more information about Monash University Clayton Campus, and how to get there by public transport and inter-campus bus service.
Closed dates During the year, the club closes for holidays, usually 1 week during Christmas break and for some University holidays. Please check the Facebook group for the latest information regarding closed dates.
